title: More Myanmar quake survivors pulled from rubble as hundreds still missing
snippets: Over 1,700 fatalities have been reported in Myanmar, with international aid arriving to assist. However, rescue operations are significantly hindered by a shortage of necessary equipment.
summary: Over 1,700 people have died in Myanmar, prompting international aid efforts. However, rescue operations face challenges due to a lack of essential equipment.

title: Trump 'very angry' with Putin over ceasefire negotiations
snippets: For the first time, former President Donald Trump has issued a serious threat of consequences against Russia if it continues to delay ceasefire negotiations in Ukraine.
summary: Former President Donald Trump has, for the first time, issued a significant warning to Russia, stating there will be consequences if it further delays ceasefire talks in Ukraine.

title: Red Cross outraged over killing of eight medics in Gaza
snippets: Last Sunday, an ambulance crew was attacked during an incident that Hamas attributes to the Israeli military.
summary: Last Sunday, an ambulance crew was targeted in an attack that Hamas claims was carried out by the Israeli military.

title: Decision day in court for Marine Le Pen's French presidential hopes
snippets: A court is set to deliver a verdict on Monday regarding allegations against the leader of the far-right National Rally party for misusing European Union funds. The outcome could impact the leader's eligibility to run in future elections.
summary: A court will announce its decision on Monday about accusations that the leader of the National Rally party misappropriated European Union funds. The verdict may affect the leader's ability to participate in upcoming elections.

title: New tariffs this week will hit all countries, Trump says
snippets: The US president is expected to announce a significant series of import taxes on Wednesday, as indicated by recent comments.
summary: The US President is set to announce a new series of import taxes on Wednesday, according to recent statements.

title: Alex Ovechkin goals tracker: Capitals star five away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's all-time record
snippets: Alex Ovechkin is on track to surpass Wayne Gretzky's scoring record in the final game of the season, maintaining his current scoring rate throughout the season.
summary: Alex Ovechkin is poised to break Wayne Gretzky's scoring record if he continues his current scoring pace until the season's final game.

title: Men's Final Four predictions, previews for Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston
snippets: The 1-seeds in San Antonio reached their positions through distinct paths, each with a unique key to potentially advancing to the final. There is also noted disagreement on the outcome of one game among analysts.
summary: The 1-seed teams in San Antonio achieved their top positions through different strategies and have unique factors that could help them advance to the final. Analysts are divided in their predictions for the outcome of one of the games.

title: 7 ejected after skirmish between Pistons, Wolves
snippets: During a basketball game on Sunday, a fight occurred in the second quarter, leading to the ejection of five players and two coaches. This incident took place during the Timberwolves' 123-104 victory over the Pistons.
summary: During a Timberwolves vs. Pistons basketball game on Sunday, a second-quarter fight resulted in the ejection of five players and two coaches. The altercation happened during the Timberwolves' 123-104 win over the Pistons.

title: Source: Tush push ban has support in committee
snippets: At the NFL league meetings in West Palm Beach, Florida, a source informed ESPN that the Green Bay Packers' proposal to ban the "tush push" technique has gained support from the NFL's competition committee.
summary: At the NFL league meetings in West Palm Beach, Florida, the Green Bay Packers' proposal to prohibit the "tush push" technique received backing from the NFL's competition committee, according to a source speaking to ESPN.

title: Durant exits loss with ankle sprain; MRI up next
snippets: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant sustained a left ankle sprain and was assisted to the locker room after colliding with Jabari Smith Jr. and falling during the third quarter of the game against the Houston Rockets on Sunday. This incident occurred with 6:57 remaining in the quarter, contributing to his team's loss.
summary: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant sprained his left ankle after a collision with Jabari Smith Jr., leading to his fall during the third quarter of Sunday's game against the Houston Rockets. The incident happened with 6:57 left in the quarter and contributed to the Suns' loss. Durant was helped to the locker room following the injury.

title: Trump threatens secondary tariffs on Russian oil if no deal on Ukraine
snippets: The US President expressed frustration with Vladimir Putin for delaying progress in ceasefire negotiations.
summary: The US President criticized Vladimir Putin for hindering progress in ceasefire talks, expressing frustration over the delays.

title: Asia stock markets tumble as Trump’s tariffs loom
snippets: Japanese and South Korean stock markets experienced declines due to worries about how their export sectors might be affected.
summary: Stock markets in Japan and South Korea fell amid concerns about the potential impact on their export sectors.

title: Trump revokes permits for oil companies in Venezuela to pressure Maduro
snippets: Authorities have taken action against Eni and Global Oil Terminals after previously cancelling Chevron's license in a Latin American country.
summary: Authorities in a Latin American country have taken action against energy companies Eni and Global Oil Terminals, following the earlier cancellation of Chevron's license in the same country.

title: It’s time for the EU to solve its Orbán problem
snippets: The European Commission has been advised to utilize its influence against Hungary's Prime Minister, who is seen as obstructive, to address issues arising from his actions.
summary: The European Commission has received advice to leverage its influence to address problems linked to actions by Hungary's Prime Minister, who is perceived as being obstructive.

title: The use and abuse of investment bank bonuses
snippets: HSBC has dismissed several bankers, choosing not to provide them with any financial compensation. This action is part of a broader strategy to overhaul the incentive structures within the company.
summary: HSBC has terminated a number of its bankers without offering them financial compensation as part of a wider initiative to reform the company's incentive systems.
